question: You and your family are living in rented accommodation in an English speaking country. You are not satisfied with the condition of some of the furniture.Write a letter to your landlord. In your letterintroduce yourselfexplain what is wrong with the furnituresay what action you would like the landlord to take
text: I am Supun Kularatne, who moved recently into the property at Bravery Street. I am writing this letter to make a complaint about some malfunctioned furniture in the house.

We arrived here last week, still we are in the process of making ourselves comfortable in our new home. I am really happy with the neighbourhood and the structure of the house, it is quite the same as I saw in the photographs that send me during our negotiations.

By the way, I some found furniture in the master bedroom which needs some attention. Especially, the wardrobe closet. Some of its drawers are really hard to move. In addition, the writing table  makes some noise when I put something on it. Since we moved here recently, and we are still new to English speaking neighbourhood, it would be a great help if you can come over here and help us by contacting someone who can fix these issues or please let me know the whereabouts of a place where I can go and do an exchange.
I would appreciate your immediate attention to this matter and I am looking forward to hearing from you.

error_list.error_des: It appears that you are missing a comma after the introductory phrase still. Consider adding a comma.
